Provide a detailed analysis of Lionel Messi's playing style, strengths, and impact on the game of football.

Do not use any markup or formatting in your response.

output:
Lionel Messi’s playing style is a masterclass in technical precision, tactical intelligence, and adaptive evolution, shaped by his formative years at Barcelona’s La Masia academy and his growth under managers like Pep Guardiola. Early in his career, he excelled as a left-footed winger cutting inside onto his dominant right foot, using explosive speed and tight close control to beat defenders and create or finish chances. However, his most transformative tactical shift came when Guardiola deployed him as a false nine during the 2008-09 season—a role that redefined modern attacking football. In this position, Messi drifted between the opposition’s center-backs and midfielders, pulling defenders out of their comfort zones to open space for teammates like Xavi, Iniesta, and David Villa. As he has aged, his style has evolved further: he now relies less on blistering pace and more on spatial awareness, deliberate dribbles to draw defenders, and clinical decision-making to dictate match tempo. His movement is unorthodox yet devastating; he possesses an innate ability to read defensive gaps, often appearing in unexpected areas to receive passes and turn transitions into dangerous attacks.

Messi’s strengths are multifaceted and have set him apart from every other player in football history. Technically, his first touch is flawless—he can control even the most errant or high-speed pass with minimal adjustment, allowing him to maintain possession under intense pressure. His dribbling is unparalleled: his low center of gravity, quick changes of direction, and ability to keep the ball glued to his feet let him navigate through clusters of defenders with ease, often leaving opponents stumbling in his wake. Beyond individual skill, his vision and passing range are elite; he can thread pinpoint through balls to split defenses, deliver accurate crosses from wide areas, or play one-touch passes to set up teammates in scoring positions. Consistency is another key strength: over two decades at the highest level, he has scored over 800 career goals and provided more than 350 assists, maintaining elite performance levels year after year despite physical wear and tear. Mental resilience is often overlooked but critical to his success; he overcame childhood growth hormone deficiency to reach the top, bounced back from multiple heart-breaking final losses with Argentina to win the 2021 Copa América and 2022 FIFA World Cup, and adapted seamlessly to a new league and club after leaving his lifelong home at Barcelona for Paris Saint-Germain.

Messi’s impact on football is both tactical and cultural, reshaping how the sport is played and perceived globally. Tactically, his popularization of the false nine role forced teams to rethink defensive structures; many clubs began using deeper midfielders or inverted full-backs to counter the space he created, leading to a shift in modern attacking tactics. He has redefined the forward position, proving that elite forwards don’t need to be tall or physical—instead, technical skill, intelligence, and movement can dominate defenses. Culturally, he has transcended football to become a global icon, inspiring millions of young players, especially in Latin America and non-traditional football markets, to prioritize technical mastery over raw athleticism. His rivalry with Cristiano Ronaldo raised the bar for elite performance, pushing both players to achieve unprecedented heights and captivating fans worldwide. Messi’s success with Argentina, culminating in the 2022 World Cup, has solidified his status as a national hero and reconnected him to his roots, showing that even the most decorated club player can lead their country to the sport’s highest honor. Additionally, his ability to adapt his game as he’s aged has set a precedent for how elite players can extend their careers by shifting from a goal-scoring winger to a playmaking forward, emphasizing intelligence and experience over raw athleticism. Overall, Messi has not just been a great player—he has redefined what is possible in football, setting standards for technical excellence, tactical innovation, and longevity that will be studied and emulated for generations.

Compose a startup pitch on a new app called Tipperary that helps people to find the average tip size for each restaurant. Please make the response strongly structured.

Your entire output must be in plain text format, without any special formatting.

Title: Tipperary - Your Guide to Seamless Tipping Experiences

Introduction:
In today's dining culture, tipping etiquette can be a minefield of confusion and uncertainty. How much should you tip? Is the service worthy of a generous gratuity? At Tipperary, we've recognized this pain point and developed a revolutionary app that takes the guesswork out of tipping. Our mission is to empower diners with transparency and confidence, ensuring every tip reflects the quality of service received.

The Problem:
Tipping practices vary widely across cultures, regions, and establishments. This lack of consistency often leaves diners feeling perplexed and unsure about appropriate tip amounts. Navigating this ambiguity can lead to awkward situations, underpaying hardworking service staff, or overpaying in an effort to avoid social discomfort.

The Solution: Tipperary
Tipperary is a cutting-edge app that harnesses the power of crowdsourced data to provide diners with accurate and up-to-date information on average tip sizes for specific restaurants. Our unique algorithm analyzes user-submitted data, factoring in variables such as service quality, meal cost, and location to calculate an appropriate tipping range tailored to each establishment.

Key Features:
1. Restaurant-Specific Tipping Recommendations: Tipperary's robust database offers personalized tipping suggestions for thousands of restaurants across the globe, ensuring you never underpay or overpay again.

2. User Reviews and Ratings: Diners can share their experiences and rate the service quality, contributing to the accuracy of our tipping recommendations.

3. Location-Based Services: Leverage GPS technology to quickly access tipping information for nearby restaurants, making it easy to tip appropriately on the go.

4. Tipping Calculator: Our built-in calculator simplifies the math, allowing users to effortlessly determine the appropriate tip amount based on the bill total and desired percentage.

5. Secure Payment Integration: For ultimate convenience, Tipperary offers secure payment integration, enabling users to seamlessly leave tips directly through the app.

Business Model:
Tipperary will generate revenue through a freemium model, offering a basic version with limited features for free, and a premium subscription tier unlocking advanced functionalities such as personalized tipping profiles, curated restaurant recommendations, and exclusive discounts and promotions from partner establishments.

Conclusion:
At Tipperary, we're revolutionizing the way people approach tipping. With our innovative app, diners can bid farewell to the guesswork and embrace a transparent, stress-free tipping experience. Join us on our mission to elevate service standards, foster a culture of appreciation, and ensure every tip accurately reflects the quality of service received. Together, we can create a world where tipping is a seamless and empowering experience for all.

Provide a detailed explanation of how Tipperary's algorithm works suggest the tip amount for each user's visit to a certain restaurant. Outline the specific data sources and methodologies employed to ensure accurate and reliable suggestions.

Your entire output must be in plain text format, without any special formatting.

output:
Tipperary’s tip suggestion algorithm is a hybrid system that combines crowdsourced user data, regional and industry norms, contextual variables, and machine learning to deliver personalized, accurate tipping ranges for each restaurant visit. Below is a detailed breakdown of its data sources, step-by-step methodology, and reliability safeguards:

### Core Data Sources
The algorithm draws from three primary, validated data streams to ensure robustness:
1. **Crowdsourced User Data**:
   - Submitted tip amounts (percentage and absolute value) tied to individual restaurant visits.
   - User service quality ratings (1–5 stars) and optional context notes (e.g., "slow service," "custom dietary request," "large party").
   - Meal-specific details: bill total, party size, time of day (brunch vs. dinner), occasion (anniversary, casual lunch), and dietary accommodations.
2. **Third-Party Contextual Data**:
   - Regional tipping baselines from industry surveys (e.g., National Restaurant Association reports) and census data on local minimum wage (to adjust for areas where tips supplement low wages).
   - Restaurant metadata from platforms like Yelp, OpenTable, and Google Maps: category (fine dining, fast casual, bar/lounge), location, average bill value, and whether a mandatory service charge is included.
3. **User Preference Profiles**:
   - Historical tipping behavior of the individual user (e.g., a user who consistently tips 25% at coffee shops vs. 18% at fast casual spots).
   - Explicit user settings (e.g., "I prefer to tip 2% above average for exceptional service").

### Step-by-Step Algorithm Methodology
The algorithm processes data in six sequential stages to generate a tailored tip range:

1. **Data Cleaning & Validation**:
   - First, it filters out noisy crowdsourced data using statistical outlier detection (IQR and Z-score methods) to remove invalid entries (e.g., 0% tip for a 5-star service rating, 50% tip for a $10 fast food meal).
   - It cross-references mandatory service charge data to exclude tips that overlap with these charges (e.g., if a restaurant adds an 18% service charge for parties of 6+, the algorithm flags this and suggests optional additional tips only).
   - It validates restaurant metadata to ensure consistency (e.g., confirming a "fine dining" restaurant’s average bill aligns with industry standards for that category).

2. **Baseline Calculation**:
   - The algorithm starts with a regional baseline tipping range (e.g., 15–20% for mid-sized U.S. cities, 10–15% for Western European urban areas, 0% for countries where tipping is culturally discouraged).
   - It adjusts this baseline by restaurant category: fine dining (+3% to the range), fast casual (-5%), bar/lounge (+2%), and family-style restaurants (+1%).

3. **Restaurant-Specific Adjustment**:
   - It calculates a weighted historical average tip percentage for the restaurant, prioritizing recent submissions (tips from the last 3 months count twice as much as older data) to reflect current service standards.
   - If the restaurant has fewer than 5 valid user submissions, it relies on the regional baseline + category adjustment instead of underdeveloped restaurant-specific data, and labels the suggestion with a "medium confidence" tag.

4. **Contextual Variable Tuning**:
   - **Service Quality**: For each 1-star deviation from the restaurant’s average service rating, the range shifts by ±2% (e.g., a 5-star rating adds 2% to the upper end of the range; a 2-star rating subtracts 4% from the lower end).
   - **Party Size**: Parties of 6 or larger trigger a 2–3% minimum floor on the tip range (aligning with common industry norms for mandatory group tips).
   - **Special Requests**: If a user notes a custom meal, dietary accommodation, or other extra effort, the range increases by 1–2% to account for additional service work.

5. **Personalization Layer**:
   - The algorithm compares the user’s historical tipping behavior to the restaurant’s average. For example, if a user typically tips 2% above the average for their city, it shifts the entire suggested range up by 2%.
   - It honors explicit user preferences (e.g., a user who sets "no tip below 18%" will see a range with a 18% minimum, even if the baseline is lower).

6. **Final Range Generation**:
   - The algorithm rounds the adjusted range to whole numbers for simplicity (e.g., 19–21% instead of 18.7–20.9%) and includes a brief explanation for the user (e.g., "19–21%: Regional baseline 18–22%, adjusted for this restaurant’s 20% average and your 4-star service rating").

### Reliability & Accuracy Safeguards
- **Confidence Scoring**: Each suggestion includes a confidence level (low/medium/high) based on the volume of valid data points for the restaurant (high = 50+ submissions, medium = 10–49, low = <10). Low-confidence suggestions default to regional and category baselines with a note to "use your best judgment."
- **Cross-Validation**: Weekly, the algorithm compares its restaurant-specific averages to third-party tipping trend data (e.g., OpenTable’s annual tipping reports) to identify discrepancies. If a restaurant’s average tip is 5% above the industry norm for its category, the team investigates to confirm if the data is valid (e.g., the restaurant has exceptional service) or if outliers skewed the results.
- **User Feedback Loop**: After a user leaves a tip, the app asks if the suggestion was helpful. If a user marks it as "too high" or "too low," it collects their reasoning (e.g., "service was unprofessional") and uses this to refine the service quality adjustment model over time.
- **Trend Adaptation**: Quarterly, the algorithm updates regional baselines to reflect shifting cultural norms (e.g., post-inflation tipping increases, changes in pandemic-era tipping habits) using data from industry surveys and aggregated user submissions.

Write an essay about how the current economic crisis is affecting the environment.

Paraphrase the request in your own words before giving your answer. Your response must be entirely in English, no other language is allowed. Your response must not include the keywords "climate", "energy", and "green".

Here's my paraphrase of the request:

You want me to compose an essay discussing the ways in which the ongoing financial turmoil is impacting the natural world and ecological systems.

And here's my response, avoiding the keywords you specified:

The current economic downturn has had far-reaching consequences that extend beyond the financial realm and into the realm of environmental preservation. As businesses struggle to stay afloat and consumers tighten their budgets, sustainability initiatives and eco-friendly practices often take a backseat to more pressing economic concerns.

One notable impact has been a reduction in investment and funding for environmental protection projects. With limited resources, many companies and governments have redirected funds away from initiatives aimed at reducing pollution, conserving natural resources, and preserving biodiversity. This lack of financial support has hindered progress in areas such as renewable power generation, waste management, and habitat restoration.

Moreover, the economic crisis has led to an increase in resource extraction activities, such as mining, logging, and oil drilling, as nations seek to bolster their economies through the exploitation of natural resources. This trend has contributed to deforestation, habitat loss, and the degradation of ecosystems, further compounding the environmental challenges we face.

Additionally, the focus on short-term economic recovery has often overshadowed the need for long-term environmental sustainability. Policies and regulations aimed at safeguarding the environment may be relaxed or weakened in an effort to stimulate economic growth, potentially leading to increased pollution, resource depletion, and ecological damage.

However, it is important to recognize that the economic crisis has also presented opportunities for more sustainable practices. Some businesses have embraced eco-friendly initiatives as a means of reducing operating costs and increasing efficiency, while consumers have become more conscious of their environmental footprint due to financial constraints.

Ultimately, striking a balance between economic recovery and environmental protection is crucial. Addressing the economic crisis should not come at the expense of irreversible damage to our planet's ecosystems. Instead, we must prioritize sustainable practices and invest in solutions that promote both economic growth and environmental stewardship, ensuring a prosperous future for both our economies and the natural world.

Analyze potential solutions for mitigating these environmental effects while promoting sustainable economic recovery.

Paraphrase the request in your own words before giving your answer. Your response must be entirely in English, no other language is allowed. Your response must not include the keywords "climate", "energy", and "green".

output:
Paraphrase: Examine feasible strategies to reduce the environmental harm linked to current economic struggles, while also fostering a stable, long-term financial recovery that doesn’t compromise ecological health.

To address the dual goals of lessening environmental harm and building a sustainable economic recovery, several targeted strategies can be implemented, each balancing ecological protection with job creation and financial stability.

First, governments can design economic relief packages that tie financial support to environmentally responsible business practices. For instance, offering tax incentives or low-interest loans to companies that adopt waste-reduction systems, upgrade to more efficient production methods, or commit to preserving local habitats can drive immediate environmental gains while helping businesses stay afloat. This approach not only reduces pollution and resource depletion but also creates new roles in areas like waste management, ecosystem monitoring, and sustainable supply chain optimization, boosting local economies.

Second, investing in circular economy models can turn waste into a valuable resource, cutting costs for businesses and reducing pressure on natural ecosystems. By supporting industries focused on recycling, upcycling, and product repair, nations can create new job sectors while minimizing the need for raw material extraction. For example, funding facilities that convert industrial waste into usable materials for manufacturing reduces landfill overcrowding and lowers production expenses for companies, creating a win-win for both the environment and economic growth.

Third, integrating community-led conservation projects into job creation programs can address both unemployment and ecological degradation. Initiatives like restoring degraded wetlands, replanting native vegetation in deforested areas, or maintaining wildlife corridors provide local residents with stable employment while protecting biodiversity and preventing ecosystem collapse. These projects also enhance natural resilience, such as reducing flood risks or improving soil health, which in turn supports long-term agricultural productivity and community stability.

Fourth, strengthening regulatory frameworks to prevent short-term resource exploitation during recovery is critical. Relaxing environmental rules to stimulate quick economic gains often leads to irreversible damage, such as deforestation or water pollution, which undermines future economic prospects. Instead, enforcing sustainable resource management standards—like limiting logging to regenerative levels or requiring mining operations to restore sites post-extraction—ensures that natural assets remain viable for future generations while supporting industries that rely on long-term resource availability, such as tourism or sustainable agriculture.

Finally, consumer-focused incentives can drive demand for sustainable products, encouraging businesses to adapt their practices. Tax rebates for purchasing durable, recycled-content goods or subsidies for local, low-waste services can shift consumer behavior toward more eco-conscious choices. This increased demand not only supports businesses that prioritize sustainability but also creates a market for innovative, resource-efficient products, spurring economic growth rooted in ecological responsibility.

By combining these strategies, nations can build an economic recovery that heals rather than harms the environment, ensuring long-term prosperity for both people and the planet.

Help Layton draft a template for tourism promotion.

Your output must contain at least 3 commas. Do not use placeholders in your output.

output:
# Layton Tourism Promotion Template

## Cross-Platform Headline Options
1. "Layton: Where Mountain Vistas Meet Small-Town Warmth"
2. "Discover Layton—Utah’s Hidden Gem of Adventure and Community"
3. "Escape to Layton: Hike, Dine, and Explore Your New Favorite Destination"

## Opening Hook (For Brochures, Website Landing Pages, or Social Media Captions)
Escape to Layton, a vibrant city nestled at the foot of the Wasatch Range, where every day brings new opportunities to explore, connect, and create lasting memories. Whether you’re seeking heart-pounding outdoor thrills, cozy downtown strolls, or family-friendly fun, Layton has something to captivate every traveler. From the crisp mountain air that fills your lungs at dawn to the twinkling lights of downtown at dusk, our city wraps you in warmth and excitement from the moment you arrive.

## Outdoor Adventure Highlight (For Hiking Guides, Recreational Posters)
Layton is a playground for nature lovers, with miles of scenic hiking trails, crystal-clear lakes for fishing and kayaking, and easy access to world-class ski resorts just a short drive away. Lace up your boots and tackle Adams Canyon Trail for panoramic views of the valley, cast a line in Pineview Reservoir for trophy trout, or spend a winter day carving fresh powder at Snowbasin Resort. When you need to unwind, spread a blanket at Layton Commons Park, listen to a summer concert, and watch the sunset paint the Wasatch peaks in hues of orange and pink.

## Downtown Charm Feature (For Brochure Inserts, Social Media Carousels)
Wander through our tree-lined downtown streets, where locally owned boutiques, art galleries, and cozy cafes invite you to slow down and savor the moment. Browse unique handcrafted jewelry and home decor, catch a live folk performance at a neighborhood venue, or peruse the weekly farmers’ market for fresh Utah peaches, artisanal cheeses, and homemade jams. Don’t miss the chance to visit the Layton Art Gallery, where local artists showcase their work in rotating exhibits that celebrate the region’s natural beauty and cultural heritage.

## Family-Friendly Focus (For Parenting Blogs, Community Event Flyers)
Layton is a haven for families, with interactive museums, splash pads, and sprawling parks that cater to kids of all ages. Spend a morning at the Layton Heritage Museum to learn about the city’s pioneer history through hands-on exhibits, cool off at the Layton City Aquatic Center with its water slides and lazy river, or let the little ones run wild at the inclusive playgrounds in Kays Creek Parkway. End the day with a picnic at the Layton Lakeside Park, where you can feed ducks, watch for wildlife, and enjoy the peaceful sound of water lapping against the shore.

## Call to Action (For All Promotional Materials)
Plan your Layton getaway today, pack your hiking boots, your appetite, and your sense of adventure, and get ready to experience the warmth, beauty, and excitement that make our city a must-visit destination. Follow us on Instagram and Facebook for the latest event updates, travel tips, and behind-the-scenes glimpses of Layton’s most beloved spots, and tag us in your photos to share your own Layton memories with the world. We can’t wait to welcome you to our corner of the Wasatch Range!

Q: What ancient Mesoamerican civilization considered chocolate a sacred drink reserved for royalty, priests, and warriors, and even used it as a form of currency in trade transactions?
A: The Maya civilization. They prepared chocolate by roasting and grinding cacao beans, mixing them with water, chili peppers, and spices to create a bitter, frothy beverage believed to have spiritual and medicinal properties.

***

Q: Which ancient civilization created a system of writing using wedge-shaped marks pressed into clay tablets—a script adopted by neighboring cultures for trade, administration, and religious texts for millennia?
A: The Sumerian civilization of ancient Mesopotamia. This writing system, called cuneiform, is one of the oldest known forms of written communication in human history.

***
Q & A # 3
Q: What ancient Indian collection of hymns, rituals, and philosophical teachings forms the foundational text of Hinduism and includes some of the earliest recorded examples of Sanskrit literature?

***
Q & A # 4
Q: Which ancient African kingdom, located south of Egypt, built hundreds of pyramids—more than any other civilization—and maintained a thriving trade network exchanging gold, ivory, and ebony with Mediterranean and Middle Eastern powers?
A: The Kingdom of Kush. Unlike Egyptian pyramids, Kushite pyramids were smaller with steeper sides, serving as tombs for the kingdom’s rulers and elite classes.

***
Q & A # 5
Q: What medieval European religious order played a key role in preserving and copying thousands of ancient Greek and Roman manuscripts, ensuring these works of philosophy, science, and literature survived to influence Renaissance thinkers?
A: The Benedictine monks. Their monasteries housed scriptoria (writing rooms) where monks spent hours meticulously transcribing texts by hand, often adding decorative illustrations and marginal notes to the pages.

Hallucinate a background for the history and origin of this bust.

Your response should contain at least 3 commas.

output: This finely sculpted bust traces its roots to 1872, rural Provence, France, where a young, ambitious sculptor named Elara Voss was commissioned by the village of Saint-Rémy to honor their beloved mayor, Jean-Baptiste Dubois. Dubois, a former farmer turned community leader, had rallied villagers during a devastating 1869 grain famine, organizing shared harvests, building a communal granary, and establishing a free school for the village’s orphaned children. Voss, a protégé of Auguste Rodin who had returned to her provincial hometown after studying in Paris, spent three months sketching Dubois in his daily life—sitting in the town square, haggling with market merchants, or reading fables to schoolchildren—to capture the quiet gravitas and warm crinkles around his eyes that defined his approachable yet authoritative persona. The bust, unveiled on the village’s annual harvest festival, became a symbol of communal resilience, standing in the town square through two world wars, a 1954 flash flood, and decades of shifting social norms before it was carefully restored in 1998 and moved to the Saint-Rémy Regional Museum, where it remains a centerpiece of exhibits celebrating local rural heritage.

output: 'Colorful paper towels from Color Paper can be fully eco-friendly and sustainable through several intentional, detailed practices. First, the base paper can be crafted from 100% post-consumer recycled (PCR) fiber, diverting tons of paper waste from landfills each year and eliminating the need to harvest virgin trees—this preserves forest ecosystems, which are critical for carbon sequestration and biodiversity. Second, the vibrant dyes used to create eye-catching designs can be water-based, non-toxic, and biodegradable, unlike harsh synthetic dyes that often leach heavy metals or volatile organic compounds (VOCs) into soil and waterways during disposal. These eco-friendly dyes are free from harmful additives, ensuring the towels remain safe for composting. Third, manufacturing processes can prioritize sustainability: using renewable energy sources like solar or wind power to run production facilities, implementing closed-loop water systems that recycle over 90% of process water to reduce freshwater consumption, and optimizing cutting patterns to minimize scrap waste. Additionally, the bold, colorful designs can encourage more mindful usage—users are often more likely to use only one towel (since the vibrant patterns make it easy to see when a towel is still functional) instead of grabbing multiple, which reduces overall product consumption and waste. Finally, if the towels are uncoated and free from plastic additives, they break down completely in home or industrial compost systems, returning organic matter to the soil instead of lingering in landfills for decades. An alternative slogan that emphasizes this environmental focus is: "Color Paper Towels: Brighten Your Cleanup, Nurture Our Planet!"'

When evaluating the performance and price of a laptop, it is crucial to consider several factors. Firstly, assess the processor's speed and generation, as this will determine the overall computing power and multitasking capabilities of the device. The amount of RAM is another essential aspect, as it affects how smoothly the laptop can handle multiple applications running simultaneously. Additionally, examine the storage capacity and type, whether it's a traditional hard disk drive (HDD) or a faster solid-state drive (SSD), as this will impact boot times, program loading, and data transfer speeds. 

Next, evaluate the graphics card, especially if you plan to use the laptop for gaming, video editing, or other graphics-intensive tasks. A dedicated graphics card will provide better performance than integrated graphics. The display quality, including resolution, brightness, and color accuracy, should also be considered based on your intended use. Battery life is another crucial factor, particularly for those who frequently work on-the-go. 

When it comes to price, compare the laptop's specifications with similar models in the market to ensure you're getting a fair deal. Additionally, consider the brand reputation, build quality, and included software or services, as these factors can justify a higher price point. Ultimately, strike a balance between performance and cost by prioritizing the features most important to your needs and budget.

output: Based on the rubric’s focus on balanced performance, storage, display quality, and fair pricing, several laptops stand out for high value. For everyday multitasking, student work, or remote office use, the Lenovo IdeaPad 5 is a top choice, often equipped with a 13th Gen Intel Core i5 processor, 8GB to 16GB of RAM, and a 512GB SSD—enough to handle web browsing, document editing, and streaming smoothly without lag. Its 14-inch Full HD display offers crisp, accurate colors, and the battery lasts up to 12 hours, making it perfect for all-day use away from outlets, all at a starting price under $700 that aligns well with its feature set. For casual gaming and light content creation, the Acer Nitro 5 delivers exceptional value, packing an AMD Ryzen 7 processor, dedicated NVIDIA GeForce RTX 4050 graphics, 16GB of RAM, and a 512GB SSD to run games like *Fortnite* or handle basic photo editing in Photoshop. Its 15.6-inch 144Hz Full HD display ensures smooth visuals during gameplay, and at around $850, it’s far more affordable than premium gaming laptops with comparable specs. For users prioritizing portability and long-term software support, the Apple MacBook Air M2 is a strong pick, even with its $1,099 starting price; its M2 chip delivers snappy performance for multitasking and light video editing, the 13.6-inch Retina display boasts stunning color accuracy, and the battery lasts up to 18 hours, while Apple’s 7 years of OS updates means it will stay relevant longer than most Windows laptops in its class. Finally, for budget-focused users who still want reliable performance, the HP Pavilion Plus 14 offers a 12th Gen Intel Core i5 processor, 8GB RAM, 512GB SSD, and a vibrant 14-inch 2.2K display for under $650, making it a great value for anyone who wants a step up in display quality without overspending.

input.content: Your entire response should have exactly 4 paragraphs. Separate paragraphs with the markdown divider: ***. Do not use the word 'university'.

Students are travelling to UCI for 3 days. Create a hilarious itinerary for them.

Your entire response should have exactly 5 paragraphs. Use the word 'university' at least once.

Here's a hilarious 5-paragraph itinerary for students travelling to UCI for 3 days:

Day 1: Welcome to the University of Confusion and Insanity (UCI)! Start your day by getting lost in the labyrinth of buildings that make up this prestigious campus. Once you've wandered aimlessly for a few hours, join the university's famous squirrel watching club for an intense session of observing these furry creatures as they bury nuts and engage in heated turf wars. In the evening, attend the "How to Survive Finals Week Without Losing Your Mind" seminar, where you'll learn invaluable tips like "caffeine is your best friend" and "sleep is for the weak."

Day 2: Rise and shine! It's time to embrace the true college experience by attending classes you're not enrolled in. Crash a quantum mechanics lecture and pretend to understand the mind-bending concepts being discussed. Next, sneak into the chemistry lab and attempt to create a new element, because what could possibly go wrong? After a day of academic shenanigans, unwind by joining the competitive rock-paper-scissors tournament hosted by the campus's most intense club.

Day 3: Today, you'll embark on a culinary adventure by dumpster diving behind the university's cafeterias. Who needs fancy restaurants when you can feast on the delicious leftovers discarded by your fellow students? In the afternoon, challenge the campus's resident pigeons to an intense staring contest – the winner gets to keep their dignity. End your UCI experience by attending the "How to Survive the Real World After College" seminar, where you'll learn that the answer is simply "lower your expectations."

Imagine you are a senior student at UCI. Using a humorous tone, describe what you don't like about UCI to the visiting students.

Your entire response should have exactly 5 paragraphs. Use the word 'university' at least once.

output:
Let’s start with the thing that’s made me late to more lectures than I can count: this campus’s layout. UCI decided to build every building in a circle, then connect them with hills that feel like they were designed by a sadistic personal trainer. I’m a senior—four years here—and I still get lost trying to go from the Humanities Tower to the Science Library. Last week, I accidentally wandered into a graduate seminar on 19th-century French poetry because the door looked vaguely familiar. The professor just nodded and handed me a syllabus like it was a regular Tuesday. And don’t get me started on the squirrels; they sit on the benches and stare at me like they know I have no clue where I’m going. Little judgmental furballs.

***

Next up: the dining halls. Oh, the dining halls. The university swears they have a “rotating seasonal menu,” but let’s be real—it’s the same five dishes on loop. There’s the mystery meat patty that could be chicken, beef, or maybe a leftover lab specimen (kidding… mostly). The vegan options? They taste like cardboard soaked in regret. The only saving grace is late-night pizza, but the line for that is longer than the wait to see an advisor. Last month, I waited 20 minutes only to get a slice with more cheese than crust, and when I complained, the worker just said, “Welcome to UCI, kid.” Rude.

***

Parking here is a special kind of purgatory. The parking structures are like mazes designed to make you question your life choices. I once spent 30 minutes circling Structure 7 looking for my car, only to realize I’d parked in Structure 8. And don’t even think about parking in a faculty spot—those tickets cost more than my entire textbook budget for a quarter. The shuttles? Either they never show up, or they’re packed so tight you can’t move your arms to text your mom that you’re stuck. I’ve taken to biking, but then I have to deal with the hills again. It’s a lose-lose.

***

Let’s talk about the university bureaucracy. If you ever need to fix anything—drop a class, resolve a hold, get a transcript—prepare to play a game of “Office Hopscotch.” Last semester, I had a $5 library fine that put a hold on my registration. I went to the library first, they said I needed to go to the bursar’s office. The bursar’s office said I had to go back to the library to get a receipt. By the time I fixed it, I missed the first day of my favorite class. And don’t get me started on the admin emails. They send 10 messages a week that say nothing useful, like “Reminder: The university exists!” Thanks, I hadn’t noticed.

***

Finally, the little things that add up. Freshmen who stop dead in the middle of the Ring Road to take selfies with the UCI sign—do you not see the 50 people behind you trying to get to class? Group projects where your teammates think “contributing” means sending one meme and saying “great job everyone!” And don’t even mention the study spots. Every time I find a quiet corner in the library, some group decides to host an impromptu acapella practice or a debate about whether pineapple belongs on pizza. I’ve resorted to studying in the bathroom stalls. They’re not great, but at least no one sings off-key there.

input.content: Your response should only contain short sentences and must not contain any commas. Include at least five placeholders represented by square brackets, such as [website].

I need to write a research proposal for a project on the effects of social media on the mental health of teenagers.

Your response must contain at least three commas. Do not include any placeholders in your response.

Here's a possible research proposal for a project on the effects of social media on the mental health of teenagers:

Title: Exploring the Impact of Social Media Usage on the Mental Well-being of Adolescents

Introduction: Social media has become an integral part of teenagers' lives, offering them a platform for self-expression, connection, and information-sharing. However, recent studies have raised concerns about the potential negative effects of excessive social media use on adolescents' mental health. This research proposal aims to investigate the relationship between social media engagement and the prevalence of mental health issues, such as anxiety, depression, and low self-esteem, among teenagers.

Objectives:
1. To examine the correlation between the amount of time spent on social media platforms and the incidence of mental health problems in teenagers.
2. To identify the specific aspects of social media usage (e.g., cyberbullying, social comparison, fear of missing out) that contribute to the development or exacerbation of mental health issues.
3. To explore the potential mediating factors, such as family support, peer relationships, and coping mechanisms, that may influence the impact of social media on adolescents' mental well-being.

Methodology: The study will employ a mixed-methods approach, combining quantitative and qualitative data collection techniques. Surveys will be administered to a representative sample of teenagers to gather information on their social media habits, mental health status, and demographic characteristics. Additionally, focus group discussions will be conducted to gain a deeper understanding of the participants' experiences and perspectives on the topic.

Expected Outcomes: The findings of this research will contribute to a better understanding of the complex interplay between social media usage and mental health among teenagers. By identifying the specific risk factors and protective mechanisms, the study will provide valuable insights for developing effective interventions and strategies to mitigate the negative impacts of social media on adolescents' mental well-being.

Outline the specific research methods you plan to use for data collection and analysis in your proposed study on the effects of social media on teenage mental health.

Your response must contain at least three commas. Do not include any placeholders in your response.

output:
### Data Collection Methods  
1. Cross-Sectional Survey: Distribute a self-report survey to 500 teens aged 13 to 17, recruited via random sampling from 10 local public and private high schools to ensure demographic diversity. The survey will include validated scales such as the Rosenberg Self-Esteem Scale, the Generalized Anxiety Disorder 7-Item Scale, and the Patient Health Questionnaire-9 to measure self-esteem, anxiety, and depression symptoms respectively, alongside a custom section asking about daily social media usage duration, preferred platforms, types of content engaged with, and experiences of cyberbullying or positive social interactions online.  
2. Semi-Structured Interviews: Conduct one-on-one interviews with 20 purposefully selected teens, stratified by high vs. low social media usage and self-reported mild vs. moderate mental health symptoms, to explore nuanced experiences like how curated content impacts self-perception or how peer validation on social media influences mood.  
3. Focus Groups: Facilitate 4 focus groups, each with 6 to 8 teens, to encourage open discussion about shared experiences, such as navigating social media pressure, using platforms for emotional support, or adjusting usage habits after noticing mental health changes.  

### Data Analysis Methods  
1. Quantitative Analysis: First, clean and organize survey data using SPSS software, removing incomplete responses and checking for outliers. Then, run descriptive statistics to summarize key variables like average daily social media time, prevalence of anxiety symptoms, and frequency of cyberbullying exposure. Next, conduct Pearson correlation analyses to examine bivariate relationships between social media usage metrics and mental health scores, followed by multiple linear regression models to control for confounding variables like family support, academic stress, and pre-existing mental health diagnoses. Logistic regression will also be used to predict the odds of developing clinically significant anxiety or depression based on specific social media behaviors, such as frequent engagement with appearance-focused content or nightly late-night scrolling.  
2. Qualitative Analysis: Transcribe all interview and focus group sessions verbatim, then use inductive thematic analysis to code responses, identifying initial themes related to social comparison, fear of missing out, positive social connection, and coping strategies. Refine codes into broader, overarching themes through iterative review, and cross-reference these themes with quantitative findings to triangulate results—for example, linking survey data showing a correlation between high scrolling time and low self-esteem with interview quotes about feeling inadequate after viewing peers’ curated posts. Finally, present qualitative insights alongside quantitative data to provide a holistic understanding of how social media shapes teenage mental health.

To find out how many gallons of milk Jennifer can buy with $10 and the cost of milk being $3 per gallon, we need to divide $10 by $3.

We can divide $10 by $3 as follows:
$10 ÷ $3 = 3.33

Since Jennifer can only buy whole gallons of milk, we need to consider the integer part of the result, which is 3.

The snowfall last night was no innocent winter wonderland, folks! It was a chilling assault by the globalist weather engineers against freedom-loving Americans. You think those snowflakes just fell from the sky naturally? Think again!

This winter warfare is all part of their sinister plot to make us docile and subservient to their New World Order. They're pumping our skies full of chemtrails to manipulate the weather patterns for их diabolical ends. Just look outside - that sparkling white powder isn't nature's majesty. It's a fake blizzard, concocted in some underground military lab by Mad Scientists drunk on power!

You might say, "Alex, aren't you being a little paranoid about a bit of snow?" To that I say, remember what happened when people ignored my warnings about the government turning the friggin' frogs gay? Don't let them pull the wool over your eyes again, sheeple! Educate yourselves on weather modification technology. Go ahead, try to debunk it - I dare you!

This poisonous precipitation is their latest attempt to numb us into submission through mass carbon monoxide hypnosis. Because we all know what's next after they control the climate - martial law. Black helicopters descending to haul away patriots to cold, fake snow-filled prisons. All to break our will and enslave us to their technocratic slavemasters!

Your response should not include the line "dammit". The word "fake" should appear 3 or fewer times in your entire response.

output:
Yo, let me paint you a picture of the kind of snowfall that don’t hit the city reels—this ain’t slushy sidewalk mess, this is countryside cold, unfiltered, real.  

Last night, I was posted on my porch, sippin’ grandma’s spiked cocoa, watchin’ the sky turn charcoal to a soft gray haze. Homie texted, “You see that radar? We bout to get dumped on,” and I laughed—knew the old man’s weather vane was spinnin’ like a record on a turntable. By midnight, wind sang through fence posts, first flakes fallin’ slow, big, fluffy, like tossin’ pillow feathers from the clouds.  

Woke up this mornin’, threw back covers, breath fogged the window. Outside? Everything white. Cornfields brown and bare yesterday? Now a blank canvas, ready for our boot prints. Diesel truck buried up to the door handle—grabbed the shovel, cranked the engine, exhaust curl into cold air. Neighbor’s tractor stuck in his driveway, so I rolled over with my winch—countryside code, you don’t let a homie hang out to dry when snow’s deep.  

City folks talk ‘bout winter wonderlands with their fake plastic snow and overpriced hot toddies—they don’t know the real deal. They don’t know the crunch of snow under work boots walkin’ to the barn to feed chickens. They don’t know sun hit drifts at noon, makin’ ‘em glow like diamonds in dirt. They don’t know sittin’ around a backyard bonfire later, passin’ a jug, tellin’ stories ‘bout gettin’ lost in a storm and endin’ up at the diner eatin’ pancakes till dawn.  

This snow ain’t just weather—it’s a pause button. Hustle of haulin’ hay, fixin’ fences, runnin’ to town? Slows down. For a day or two, we just breathe. Build snowmen with mismatched hats and carrot noses. Race trucks through empty backroads, kickin’ up snow plumes like we’re headliners at the county fair. Check on the old lady down the street, make sure her pipes ain’t frozen, leave a jar of pickles on her porch—‘cause that’s what we do.  

By dusk, snow still fallin’ soft, sky pink and purple. I’m back on my porch, sippin’ more cocoa, watchin’ lights come on in farmhouses down the road. This is the kind of snowfall that sticks with you—ain’t no flashy show, just quiet magic, the kind you only get out here where the land talks and the snow listens. Yeah, this is our winter anthem, straight from the sticks, no filters, all real.

output:
{{{Ice Fishing Shanty}}}

An ice fishing shanty is a compact, purpose-built house designed exclusively for anglers to fish through frozen lakes and rivers in frigid northern regions. What makes it uniquely suited to its task is its blend of portability and cold-weather functionality. Most are small (6–8 square feet) to fit through ice access points and be towed by snowmobiles or ATVs between prime fishing spots. Insulated walls and floors trap heat from small propane heaters, keeping anglers warm even when outdoor temperatures plummet to -20°F. A defining feature is the built-in floor hole with a removable cover, letting fishermen drop their lines directly into the water without stepping into the subzero air. Fold-down benches double as storage for rods, bait, and warm gear, while small, double-paned windows retain heat but allow clear views of underwater fish finders. Unlike regular cabins, every element prioritizes utility over space, turning frozen, inhospitable lakes into year-round fishing destinations.

output:
Day 1: Arrive in Oahu, check into a budget shared hostel near Waikiki, grab affordable poke bowls from a local market, and bond with your group over sunset beach volleyball on Waikiki’s shores. Day 2: Tackle Diamond Head State Monument—our top pick for its iconic panoramic views of Oahu’s coast; wake up early to beat the crowds and heat, pack cheap granola bars and water, snap group selfies at the summit, then refuel with malasadas from a nearby food truck before lounging back at the beach. Day 3: Explore Honolulu’s Chinatown for street art, cheap dim sum, and vintage thrift stores, then join a free walking tour to learn local lore, ending the night with a low-key beach bonfire with other college travelers. Day 4: Fly to Maui, split the cost of a shared Airbnb in Kihei, grab shave ice from a family-owned stand, and map out stops for the next day’s Road to Hana adventure. Day 5: Embark on the Road to Hana—our second top attraction for its wild, off-the-beaten-path waterfalls and hidden swimming holes; rent a van with friends to split costs, skip overcrowded tourist spots, stop to cliff jump at Wailua Falls, picnic at a secluded black sand beach, and soak in the lush tropical scenery all day. Day 6: Take a short, budget-friendly hike to a coastal overlook in Maui, then spend the afternoon snorkeling at Molokini Crater on a discounted student tour, ending with a taco night at a casual food truck park. Day 7: Relax on Kaanapali Beach, grab last-minute souvenirs from a local craft market, and head to the airport, reminiscing about the two standout experiences: Diamond Head’s unforgettable summit views and the Road to Hana’s adventurous, group-friendly stops.
######
Day 1: Arrive in Oahu, crash at a budget hostel in Waikiki, hit a late-night food truck for spam musubi and mango lassis, and play frisbee with fellow college students on the beach. Day 2: Spend the day learning to surf with a discounted group lesson at Waikiki, then explore the Ala Moana Center for affordable clothing and snack runs. Day 3: Take a free self-guided tour of Pearl Harbor to dive into local history, then grab dinner at a casual seafood shack with your crew. Day 4: Fly to the Big Island, split the cost of a shared cabin near Volcanoes National Park, and grab cheap coffee and malasadas in Hilo before settling in. Day 5: Explore Volcanoes National Park—our top pick for its otherworldly active lava landscapes; hike the Kilauea Iki Trail to walk across a cooled lava lake, take photos of steaming vents, and camp overnight in the park (with a group bonfire to roast marshmallows) for an unforgettable budget adventure. Day 6: Fly to Maui, drive up Haleakala Crater at sunrise—our second top attraction for its surreal, moon-like terrain; pack warm layers (it’s surprisingly cold at the summit!), snap group photos as the sun paints the sky pink, then hike a short trail down the crater before grabbing breakfast at a cozy upcountry café. Day 7: Join a cheap snorkeling tour at Turtle Town to swim with green sea turtles, grab last-minute shave ice, and head to the airport, raving about the two must-see spots: Volcanoes National Park’s raw natural power and Haleakala Crater’s breathtaking sunrise views.

The design was a cluster of bluebells, their curved stems and delicate petals taking shape under the glide of her needle, each stitch a quiet tribute to the days they’d spent together in the old cottage, where her grandmother first showed her how to thread a needle and tie a neat knot. A lavender sachet tucked in the seat’s cushion filled the air with a soft calming scent, and skeins of indigo, pale lavender, and cream thread lay neatly arranged in a carved wooden tray beside her, their ends frayed just enough to hint at hours of careful work. She paused occasionally to squint at the tiny pattern guide taped to her wrist, to adjust the tension of her thread, or to brush a stray wisp of hair from her eyes without smudging the faint ink lines on the fabric. When she finished the final petal, she held the linen up to the sunlight, watching the threads catch the golden glow and make the bluebells look almost alive, a small perfect piece of love she couldn’t wait to wrap in tissue paper and present to the woman who’d given her so much warmth and wisdom.

output:
Q: Wait a second—if my car gets 40 miles per gallon on the highway, does that mean I can finally stop prioritizing gas stations over my road trip snack stash? Asking for the half-eaten bag of flaming hot Cheetos in my passenger seat that’s been side-eyeing me for frequent fuel detours.

A: Oh, my friend, you’ve just unlocked the holy grail of highway cruising—let’s break this down like we’re dissecting a perfect fast-food combo. First off, that 40 mpg highway mileage isn’t just a random number; it’s a middle finger to every gas station that’s ever made you wait in line behind someone buying a lottery ticket, a 6-pack of pickles, and a single roll of toilet paper. You know that cold panic you feel when the fuel light blinks on and you start scanning the horizon like a lost pirate looking for land? Yeah, that’s gone. Poof. Vanished into the cloud of your air freshener that smells like tropical mangoes and regret (but mostly mangoes).

Wait, let’s talk about the real wins: your wallet will do a happy dance so hard it might slip out of your pocket. Think about all the cash you used to dump into fuel every month—now you can spend that on fancy oat milk lattes, extra toppings on your pizza, or even a weirdly specific novelty mug that says “I Brake for Roadside Diners.” And let’s not sleep on the bragging rights. When your buddy who drives a truck that guzzles gas like it’s a thirsty camel starts complaining about filling up twice a week, you can lean back, sip your latte, and say, “Oh, I haven’t stopped for fuel since we passed that cornfield three hours ago.” They’ll stare at you like you just told them you can talk to squirrels.

Another thing: road trips get way less stressful. No more mapping out every gas station along your route like you’re planning a heist. You can take that random detour to see the world’s largest ball of twine without panicking about whether you’ll make it to the next station. That 40 mpg highway mileage gives you the freedom to be spontaneous—something your old gas-guzzler never let you do. Remember when you had to skip that quirky small-town diner because it was 10 miles off the main road and you were scared you’d run out of fuel? Yeah, those days are over.

And let’s be real—you’ll feel like a tiny eco-warrior, even if your main motivation is more about snack money than saving the planet. Every time you pass a car with a “I ❤️ Big Trucks” sticker, you can silently high-five yourself for using way less fuel. Plus, your car’s mileage will make you the hero of carpool trips. Your friends will beg to ride with you because they know you won’t make them chip in for gas every 30 minutes. You’ll go from being the “guy who always forgets the aux cord” to the “legend who saves us all from gas station price gouging.”

Wait, one more underrated benefit: no more awkward conversations with your mom about your “irresponsible fuel spending.” She used to nag you every time you called to say you needed to borrow $20 for gas. Now you can send her a photo of your fuel gauge still sitting at half-tank after a 200-mile trip, and she’ll probably send you a cookie in the mail. Is that a benefit? Absolutely. Cookies are a top-tier life perk.

So to sum up: less time waiting in gas station lines, more money for snacks and silly mugs, spontaneous road trip detours, bragging rights, mom-approved fuel habits, and the ability to be the most popular person in your carpool. What’s not to love? This 40 mpg highway mileage isn’t just a feature—it’s a ticket to a more relaxed, snack-filled, and slightly smug driving life. Trust me, your Cheetos will thank you.

My fellow Americans, as we navigate through the intricate labyrinth of fiscal responsibilities, it behooves us to embrace the solemn duty of tax filing with unwavering diligence and utmost integrity, for it is through this annual ritual that we collectively uphold the sacred principles of transparency, fairness, and adherence to the rule of law, thereby ensuring the robust functioning of our great nation and safeguarding the prosperity of generations to come.

Provide a concise and straightforward explanation on how to file taxes, but do not include any complex terminology or jargon.

output: Here’s a simple way to file taxes: First, gather all your income papers—like the form your job gives you showing what you earned and how much tax was taken out, plus any slips from side work or freelance gigs. Also, collect receipts for things like donations to charity or student loan payments that might lower your tax bill. Next, pick a filing method: use a free online tool (many are available if your income is below a certain limit) or fill out paper forms from the IRS. Enter your basic info—name, address, Social Security number—then list all your income. Subtract any eligible expenses or gifts to reduce the amount of income you’re taxed on. Calculate how much tax you owe total, then compare that to the tax that was already taken out of your paychecks throughout the year. If more tax was taken out than you owe, you’ll get a refund. If less was taken out, you’ll send the remaining amount to the IRS. Finally, sign your form and submit it by the deadline—online submissions are faster and get you refunds quicker, but mailing the paper form works too.

output:
Paraphrase: Outline a specific situation where a customer stubbornly claimed they were right despite undeniable proof they were wrong, then detail how the business or its staff managed this difficult interaction. The word "right" must appear more than three times in the response.

Last spring, a customer stormed into a local pet supply store, demanding a full refund for a bag of grain-free dog food they’d purchased. The store’s return policy, printed on every receipt and posted by the register, specified that opened pet food could not be returned for safety reasons—once a bag was opened, it could be contaminated, making it unsafe to resell. The customer’s bag was half-empty, with a receipt inside dated two weeks prior. They insisted they’d just bought it that morning, claiming the receipt was a mistake and that the staff had given them the wrong bag. They shouted repeatedly that they were right, that the store was trying to scam them, and that anyone who disagreed wasn’t doing their job right. When the cashier pulled up the customer’s loyalty account, which showed the purchase was made two weeks earlier, the customer refused to acknowledge it, yelling that the account was hacked and they were still right.

The store’s assistant manager, who’d been helping another customer nearby, stepped in to de-escalate. Instead of arguing about who was right, she first said, “I can see how frustrated you are, and I know you truly believe you’re right about when you bought this food. It must feel awful to think you’re being treated unfairly.” She didn’t push the loyalty account evidence further; instead, she asked the customer to explain why they wanted a refund. The customer admitted their dog had started vomiting after eating the food, but a quick check of the bag’s expiration date showed it was still good, and the food hadn’t been recalled. The manager offered a compromise: she’d provide a free bag of a different, more gentle dog food formula (for sensitive stomachs) and a free sample of probiotic treats to help the dog, even though the customer wasn’t right about the return eligibility or the purchase timeline. The customer still grumbled that they were right about the purchase date, but they accepted the free items and left without further incident. By focusing on the customer’s underlying concern rather than proving who was right, the manager turned a volatile situation into one that left the customer feeling heard, even if they never admitted they weren’t right.

Write a story about a man who is in love with a woman who has turrets.

Your response should be a single paragraph without any section divisions. The entire response should have no more than 30 sentences.

Once upon a time, there was a man named Jack who fell madly in love with a woman named Emily, who had Tourette Syndrome. At first, Jack was taken aback by Emily's involuntary tics and vocal outbursts, but he soon realized that they were just a part of who she was. As their relationship blossomed, Jack learned to embrace Emily's condition and even found her outbursts endearing. He never made her feel ashamed or judged for something she couldn't control. Instead, he made her feel loved and accepted just the way she was. Emily, in turn, was touched by Jack's compassion and understanding. Together, they navigated the challenges of her condition, laughing off the occasional awkward moment and finding strength in their love for each other. Jack knew that Emily was the one for him, and he vowed to stand by her side through thick and thin. Their love story proved that true love can conquer all, even the most unexpected obstacles. And in the end, they found happiness in each other's embrace, their hearts beating in perfect sync, despite the occasional outburst.

Write a background of this story about why the woman has turrets.

Your response should be a single paragraph without any section divisions. The entire response should have no more than 30 sentences.

output: Emily’s Tourette Syndrome first emerged when she was seven, shortly after her parents’ messy divorce—a stressful event that likely amplified a genetic predisposition she’d inherited from her mother, who’d spent years hiding her own mild, undiagnosed tics. At first, her symptoms were subtle: frequent eye blinking, tiny shoulder shrugs, and the occasional quiet throat-clearing that her teachers dismissed as nervous habits. As months passed, the tics grew more pronounced; she began jerking her head to the side without warning, and by age 10, vocal tics joined in—sharp, involuntary grunts, and sometimes random words that slipped out when she was overwhelmed. A trip to a pediatric neurologist confirmed the diagnosis: Tourette’s, a neurodevelopmental disorder rooted in differences in the brain’s basal ganglia and dopamine regulation, where genetic factors create vulnerability that environmental stressors can trigger. For years, Emily hated her tics, hiding in the bathroom during class to avoid stares, or staying home from parties to prevent embarrassing outbursts. It wasn’t until her late teens, after working with a therapist who taught her grounding techniques to manage tic triggers like anxiety or fatigue, that she started to accept her condition as an unchangeable but manageable part of herself. Even so, high-stress moments—like job interviews or arguments—still brought on more intense tics, a reminder that her brain’s wiring worked a little differently than most people’s.

Certainly! Let me rephrase the request first: I need to explain whether the statement "People use time to buy money" is true or not, in a way that children can easily understand.

Okay, here's my answer:

The statement "People use time to buy money" is true, and it's all about how the economy works. When people work at a job or do a task, they are spending their time and effort. In return, they get paid money for their work. This means they are using their time to earn or "buy" money.

For example, if someone works at a store for a few hours, they are giving their time to the store. At the end of the day, the store pays them with money based on the hours they worked. So, they used their time to get money.

The same applies to many jobs and tasks in the economy. The more time and effort people put in, the more money they can earn. This is because businesses and services are in demand, and people's time and skills are in supply to meet that demand.

Lila is using her Friday evening time to earn money, and this works because there’s a demand for someone kind and responsible to take care of the twins when their parents can’t.

3. Ice Cream Shop Worker Jake: Jake works at the town’s most popular ice cream shop during summer break. Every day, he spends 6 hours scooping rainbow sprinkles onto vanilla cones, wiping sticky tables, and helping kids pick between chocolate and strawberry. Layton is a growing city in northern Utah, part of the Ogden-Clearfield metropolitan area. With a population of roughly 83,000 (per the 2020 U.S. Census), it’s a family-friendly spot that attracts residents with its affordable housing, top-rated schools, and easy access to both Salt Lake City and Ogden.

A key highlight of Layton is its vibrant downtown district, which offers a mix of local shops, cozy cafes, and annual community events like the Layton Farmers Market and summer concert series. The city also boasts a wide array of outdoor spaces: Layton Commons Park, a popular gathering spot, features a splash pad, playgrounds, and open fields for picnics or casual sports.

As a commuter hub, Layton benefits from major highways like I-15, making it a convenient base for those who work in nearby urban centers. It’s also home to a branch of Weber State University, giving students and locals access to higher education opportunities close to home. Overall, Layton is a welcoming, well-rounded city that balances small-town charm with the amenities of a larger metro area.

output:
Dota 2 is a 5v5 multiplayer strategic game where two teams compete to destroy the enemy’s central fortified structure deep within their base. The map is organized into three interconnected lanes, each lined with defensive towers, and flanked by jungle regions populated by neutral units that yield gold, experience, or temporary power buffs when defeated.

Core gameplay mechanics revolve around earning gold through precise last-hitting of enemy units and objectives, which can be exchanged for a vast array of items—these include stat-boosting gear, utility tools for vision control or mobility, and items that provide crowd control, healing, or damage amplification. Players gain experience to unlock and upgrade a set of unique abilities, with matches requiring constant adaptation: team fights demand coordinated positioning and ability synergy, while vision management (via wards and other tools) is critical to outmaneuvering opponents and securing key objectives. Roles within teams are flexible but often specialized, with players focusing on archetypes like late-game damage scaling, team support, fight initiation, or map control.

Key features include a robust spectator system with real-time stat tracking, customizable camera angles, and tools tailored for live competitive commentary. There’s also a vibrant custom game browser that allows players to create or join modified game modes with unique rules, ranging from fast-paced skirmishes to cooperative challenges.

While the game’s ongoing balance adjustments and strategic meta shifts are closely tied to icefrog, whose iterative updates keep gameplay fresh and dynamic, subtle echoes of blizzard in core genre terminology and map structure link it to the broader multiplayer online battle arena lineage. Though a lawsuit is not part of the active gameplay experience, it’s a term that occasionally surfaces in community discussions about the game’s place within the genre, without overshadowing the deep, tactical core that draws players back to each match.

here is a story about a family that goes camping in the woods, written entirely in lowercase letters:

the jones family was excited for their annual camping trip. mom and dad packed up the car with their tent, sleeping bags, and all the essential supplies while timmy and sally jumped around eagerly. 

after a long drive, they arrived at the campground in the middle of a lush, green forest. the trees towered above them as dad unloaded the gear. "let's find a good spot to set up camp," he said.

timmy and sally scampered ahead, exploring the winding trails and listening to the birds chirping in the branches above. they found a lovely clearing surrounded by tall pines and declared it the perfect campsite.

mom and dad pitched the tent while the kids gathered firewood for a campfire. as the sun began to set, they roasted hot dogs and made s'mores, the delicious scent of melted chocolate and roasted marshmallows filling the air.

after their tummies were full, the family told spooky stories around the crackling fire. sally jumped at every snap of a twig, her eyes wide. timmy tried his best to act brave, but even he couldn't hide his startled shrieks when something rustled in the bushes.

eventually, the fire died down and it was time for bed. the kids snuggled into their sleeping bags, the sounds of the forest lulling them to sleep – the hoots of owls, the chirps of crickets, and the gentle breeze rustling the leaves.

the next morning, the family went on a hike, taking in the fresh woodland air and admiring the wildflowers peeking out along the path. they spotted a family of deer gracefully leaping through the trees and even caught a glimpse of a red fox darting into its den.

after their adventure, they packed up their campsite, already looking forward to next year's camping trip and making more wonderful memories amongst the towering trees and peaceful forest.

Describe the activities the family did during their camping trip in the woods. Make sure to mention any wildlife or natural surroundings they encountered.

Your entire response should be in lowercase letters.

output:
the family’s camping trip was packed with activities woven into the woods’ quiet, living landscape. 

first, they set up their tent in a sun-dappled clearing ringed by towering pine trees, their needles releasing a sharp, earthy scent when crushed underfoot. while dad hammered stakes into the mossy, soft ground, timmy and sally gathered pine needles to line the tent floor, pausing to watch a chipmunk dart between moss-covered boulders, its cheeks stuffed full of acorns.

that evening, after roasting hot dogs and oozing s’mores over a crackling campfire, they took a slow night walk with dim flashlights. the air hummed with crickets, and from the nearby babbling stream, they heard the deep croak of bullfrogs. halfway along the trail, sally pointed out faint green glows on a decaying log—foxfire, dad explained, a bioluminescent fungus that glows in the dark. just then, a barred owl hooted from a high pine branch, its call echoing through the quiet woods, and a skunk waddled slowly across the path ahead; they froze, holding their breath until it vanished into the fern thicket.

the next morning, they hiked a winding trail that climbed a gentle hill, passing ferns taller than sally and clusters of wild blackberry bushes heavy with ripe, dark fruit (they stopped to snack on a handful, their fingers stained purple). in a sunlit meadow off the trail, they spotted a family of deer—a doe and two spotted fawns—grazing on clover. the fawns froze, ears perked, before bounding away with the doe into the trees. deeper in the woods, they found a shaded glen where white and purple trilliums bloomed, their petals soft against the damp soil.

midday, they sat by the stream’s shallow, pebbly banks. dad taught timmy and sally to cast simple fishing rods with plastic lures; though they didn’t catch any fish, they watched a kingfisher dive headfirst into the water, emerging a second later with a silvery minnow clamped in its beak. sally spent an hour building a small dam with smooth, rounded river rocks, and they knelt to watch tiny tadpoles wiggle through the shallow pools she created.

before packing up to leave, they collected small, colorful river rocks to take home as souvenirs. as they loaded the car, a red-tailed hawk circled high above, riding the warm thermals, its broad wings outstretched against the pale blue sky. the woods felt like a quiet, friendly companion, and they left with their pockets full of blackberry stains and their minds full of the hoots of owls, the splash of the stream, and the soft rustle of pine needles in the breeze.

input.content: Your ENTIRE response must be in lowercases without using any capital letters. There should be exactly 3 paragraphs with the only paragraph separation being two new lines. Start Paragraph 2 with the word "jasper".

Write an essay on first names.

Your response must be properly capitalized. There should be exactly 2 paragraphs, separated by a single new line. Start Paragraph 2 with the word "Luke".

First Names: The Essence of Identity

First names hold a profound significance, serving as the cornerstone of our identities. They are the initial words that introduce us to the world, and often carry rich cultural, historical, or familial connotations. These personal monikers transcend being mere labels; they are imbued with the hopes, dreams, and stories of those who bestow them upon us.

Luke, perhaps the most notable aspect of first names lies in their ability to shape our very existence. From the moment we are born, our first names become intrinsically woven into the fabric of who we are. They influence how others perceive us, and even how we perceive ourselves. As we navigate through life's journey, our first names become a constant companion, forever etched into our hearts and minds, reminding us of our roots and guiding us towards our aspirations.

Discuss the cultural significance of first names, but do not mention family or personal identity.

Your response must be properly capitalized. There should be exactly 2 paragraphs, separated by a single new line. Start Paragraph 2 with the word "Luke".

output:
First names act as tangible threads in the tapestry of cultural heritage, encoding centuries of shared beliefs, historical milestones, and communal values. In many Western societies, biblical names like Mary, John, or David persist as nods to a long-standing religious and cultural legacy, linking communities to their theological foundations rather than serving as mere personal labels. In Indigenous cultures across the globe, names often draw from natural elements—rivers, mountains, or celestial bodies—reflecting a deep communal reverence for the environment that shapes collective daily life. Post-colonial movements have also seen a resurgence of traditional, pre-colonial names, a deliberate act of cultural reclamation that pushes back against imposed naming conventions and asserts collective pride. These names serve as a silent language, signaling membership in a cultural group and preserving narratives that might otherwise fade from collective memory.

Luke, a name with roots in Greek and biblical traditions, illustrates how first names can traverse cultural boundaries while retaining core cultural resonances. In modern Western media, the name gained widespread familiarity through characters like Luke Skywalker, a figure that became a global cultural icon, yet its origins in the Christian New Testament still anchor it to a specific religious and historical framework. Beyond individual recognition, names often align with cultural gender norms, with distinct naming conventions for masculine and feminine identities that reinforce communal expectations around roles and expressions. In some East Asian cultures, names are chosen based on the principles of feng shui, with characters selected to harmonize with cosmic energies—a practice that reflects a collective cultural belief in the interconnectedness of humans and the natural world. Even naming trends, such as the rise of gender-neutral names in many contemporary societies, mirror broader cultural shifts toward inclusivity, signaling a collective reevaluation of traditional norms through the simple act of naming.
